name: harvesting
content:
harvesting noun [U]
(CROPS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the activity of picking and collecting crops, or of collecting plants, animals, or fish as food: When maize cultivation was introduced it was probably women who did the growing and harvesting of the crops. Abalone harvesting has been prohibited in local waters since the mid-1990s. Timber harvesting in the boreal forest is huge in scope.

harvesting noun [U]
(SUBSTANCE)
the activity of taking or collecting a useful substance, for example water or a chemical element, from somewhere so that it can be used: When we started rainwater harvesting, we used the rainwater for washing, cooking, and drinking. The area would be a good site for tidal energy harvesting.

harvesting noun [U]
(BODY PARTS)
the activity of taking cells or other body parts from someone for medical use: There is a lot of controversy surrounding the harvesting of stem cells. Large-scale harvesting of eggs from women can be medically risky.

harvesting noun [U]
(INFORMATION)
the activity of collecting large quantities of information, especially automatically: The company has been accused of unauthorised data harvesting from social media accounts. Online users are suspicious of cookies and the harvesting of user information.
